genre: indie rock, garage rock, Arctic Monkeys-inspired, melodic overdriven guitars, nocturnal urban vibe

lines: (instrumental intro – shimmering bridge pickup guitar riff, subtle tape‑saturated ambience, drums enter with a soft hi‑hat groove at 00:20)
Neon flickers on the cracked sidewalk, a pulse in midnight rain
Screen‑lit faces drift like ghosts, scrolling through the same refrain
The city hums a low‑key static, a soundtrack to our lone parade
I trace the glow on window panes, wondering if we ever fade
We’re screaming into the void of neon light
Chasing silhouettes that melt into the night
If the skyline folds and the colors bleed away
Will you still hear the echo of the words we say?
(instrumental break – lead guitar weaves a melodic line over a tight, groove‑focused drum pocket, bass holds a steady pulse)
Coffee cups and data streams, the city never sleeps
Your voice is pixel‑thin, a whisper through the streets
Every billboard blazes louder, drowning out the sighs
Yet in the static silence, I still search for your eyes
We’re screaming into the void of neon light
Chasing silhouettes that melt into the night
If the skyline folds and the colors bleed away
Will you still hear the echo of the words we say?
Maybe we’re just shadows cast by LED dreams
Lost in the glare, trying to find what it means
We’re screaming into the void of neon light
Chasing silhouettes that melt into the night
If the skyline folds and the colors bleed away
Will you still hear the echo of the words we say?
(extended outro – layered guitars swell, drums fade into a distant reverb, city ambience lingers as the track slowly fades out)
